item.title: Ex-Government Bigwigs Find New Purpose as Inefficiency Consultants for Billionaires
item.description: In a surprising turn of events, former government bigwigs who were once criticized for their inefficiency have found a new lease on life as highly-paid consultants for the very billionaires who once lobbied for their positions to be eliminated. The Efficiency Paradox The trend began when tech mogul Richard Vanderlay III, known for his ruthless cost-cutting measures, made a shocking discovery. “I fired my entire HR department and replaced them with ex-DMV workers,” Vanderlay explained.
